data.value: Find a root of a scalar function.
A function to find a root of.
Extra arguments passed to the objective function and its derivative(s).
Type of solver.  Should be one of
- 'bisect'
- 'brentq'
- 'brenth'
- 'ridder'
- 'toms748'
- 'newton'
- 'secant'
- 'halley'

data.param: bracket: A sequence of 2 floats, optional

data.value: An interval bracketing a root.
must have different signs at the two endpoints.
Initial guess.
A second guess.

If

can also be a callable returning the second derivative of

Tolerance (absolute) for termination.
Tolerance (relative) for termination.
Maximum number of iterations.

The solution represented as a
object. Important attributes are:
the solution ,
a boolean flag indicating if the algorithm exited successfully and
which describes the cause of the termination. See

This section describes the available solvers that can be selected by the 'method' parameter.

The default is to use the best method available for the situation presented. If a bracket is provided, it may use one of the bracketing methods. If a derivative and an initial value are specified, it may select one of the derivative-based methods. If no method is judged applicable, it will raise an Exception.
Find the root of a simple cubic

entries: # only one real root at x = 1

data.value: The
method takes as input a bracket
The
method takes as input a single point and uses the derivative(s)
The function can provide the value and derivative(s) in a single call.
Additional options accepted by the solvers
Find a root of a vector function.

signature: root_scalar(f, args=(), method=None, bracket=None, fprime=None, fprime2=None, x0=None, x1=None, xtol=None, rtol=None, maxiter=None, options=None)
